definition: the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Four Great Inventions have been our pride till today.
sentences.chinese: 四大发明至今都令我们自豪。

sentences.english: Four great inventions in human history, science and culture left a brilliant page.
sentences.chinese: 四大发明，在人类科学文化史上留下了灿烂的一页。

sentences.english: What are the Four Great Inventions of ancient China?
sentences.chinese: 中国古代的四大发明是什么？

sentences.english: Do you know our four great inventions?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我国的四大发明吗？

sentences.english: They don't need the four great inventions anymore.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再需要四大发明。

sentences.english: Gunpowder is one among the four great inventions of ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 火药是中国古代四大发明之一。

sentences.english: Paper, one of the Four Great Inventions of ancient China, was spread to the west through the Silk Road.
sentences.chinese: 纸是中国四大发明之一，通过丝绸之路传到西方。

definition: to invent and innovate/inventions and innovations
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132/abbr. for 候風地動儀|候风地动仪
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Science and technology is the number one productive force (from 1978 speech by Deng Xiaoping 鄧小平|邓小平 introducing the Four Modernizations 四個現代化|四个现代化).
pinyin: ke1 xue2 ji4 shu4 shi4 di4 yi1 sheng1 chan3 li4
related.word: 科学技术是第一生产力
